Wisdom: اسْتُرِ الْعَوْرَةَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتَ يَسْتُرِ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ مِنْكَ مَا تُحِبُّ سَتْرَهُ
enWisdom: Hide the flaws [of others] as much as you can and Allah, the Glorified, will hide for you that which you would like to remain hidden

Wisdom: إِنَّ لِلنَّاسِ عُيُوباً فَلَا تَكْشِفْ مَا غَابَ عَنْكَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ يَحْكُمُ عَلَيْهَا وَاسْتُرِ الْعَوْرَةَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتَ يَسْتُرِ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ مَا تُحِبُّ سَتْرَهُ
enWisdom: Verily everyone has faults, so do not expose that which is hidden from you, for indeed Allah, the Glorified, has hidden them out of clemency; and hide the faults [of others] as much as possible, [and in return] Allah, the Glorified, will hide that which you would like to remain hidden
The most hated of all people is the fault-finder

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ أَخْلَاقِ الْكَرِيمِ [كثرة] تَغَافُلُهُ عَمَّا يَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: The most honourable quality of the noble one is his feigning inattention [and ignorance] about that which he is aware [regarding the negative traits of others]
Scrutinizing the faults of others is a fault [in itself]
Feign heedlessness [about the mistakes of others] and your affair will be praised

Wisdom: تَتَبُّعُ الْعُيُوبِ مِنْ أَقْبَحِ الْعُيُوبِ وَشَرِّ السَّيِّئَاتِ
enWisdom: Pursuing the faults [of others] is from the most detestable of faults and worst evils

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَتَغَافَلْ وَلَا يَغُضَّ [لَا يتقاض‏] عَنْ كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْأُمُورِ تَنَغَّصَتْ عِيشَتُهُ
enWisdom: One who does not feign negligence and lower his gaze in many situations, his life becomes bitter

Wisdom: تَغَمَّدِ الذُّنُوبَ بِالْغُفْرَانِ سِيَّمَا [لَا سِيَّمَا] فِي ذَوِي الْمُرُوءَةِ وَالْهَيْئَاتِ
enWisdom: Cover up offences with forgiveness, especially for those who possess magnanimity and social standing
